thread.title: Dele Alli reveals frustration at lack of goals inspired scoring run after winning Premier League player of the month
thread.title_full: Dele Alli reveals frustration at lack of goals inspired scoring run after winning Premier League player of the month

author: James Whaling
title: Dele Alli reveals frustration at lack of goals inspired scoring run after winning Premier League player of the month
text:
Sport Dele Alli reveals frustration at lack of goals inspired scoring run after winning Premier League player of the month The Spurs midfielder went on a seven-game scoreless run before netting eight times in his next six outings to help propel Spurs to second in the table Share Alli collects his Premier League player of the month award for January (Photo: Alex Morton / Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Tottenham star Dele Alli has revealed his frustration at failing to find the net inspired the goal scoring run which led to him picking up the Premier League's player of the month award for January. 
England midfielder Alli went on a seven-game scoreless run before netting eight times in his next six outings to help propel Spurs to second in the table. 
The 20-year-old admits his lack of goals were getting him down, before it begun to click at the turn of the year. 
Alli, speaking to EASPORTS.com , said: "I was getting frustrated as I was getting into the right positions to get goals and assists but it just wasn’t happening, and then it seemed to just click over night and I started putting them away. Alli went on a run of eight goals in six matches (Photo: Jason Cairnduff/Reuters) The England man admits he was growing frustrated at not finding the net (Photo: AMA/Getty) 
"I was grateful to finally start getting some goals. 
"It's great [to win player of the month], you see who wins it and some of the great players who have won it in the past. 
"The team has done really well this month, not just me individually. We’ve had a lot of players who have been in form so it’s a real honour for me to win it." 
Alli has continued to develop his relationship with Harry Kane this season after striking up a brilliant understanding last term, contributing to Spurs' closest tilt at the Premier League title. Tottenham's Harry Kane celebrates scoring their first goal with Dele Alli (Photo: Reuters) Read More Tottenham warned title dreams could scupper top four hopes by captain Hugo Lloris 
And he admits his teammate for club and country is the first to remind him when he fails to hit the target. 
"He’s always the first to tell me when I’ve missed a chance," Alli added. He’s a great player and he’s scored a lot of goals as well. 
"I’m sure he will continue to keep scoring goals, that’s the sort of player he is. It’s a real privilege to play with a player like him. Dele Alli was speaking to EASPORTS.com at the presentation of the EA SPORTS Player Of The Month Award. To read the full interview, go to https://www.easports.com/uk/fifa/news/2017/epl-player-of-the-month-january poll loading Can Tottenham still win the title? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
